definition:
A *Baumslag-Solitar group* is a group with presentation
$$\langle b,t\mid t^{-1}b^mt=b^n\rangle$$ for some non-zero integers $m$
and $n$.

These groups were studied by Baumslag and Solitar[@bs], who were
interested in finding examples of finitely generated groups. In
particular, the group $$\langle b,t\mid t^{-1}b^2t=b^3\rangle$$ is
non-Hopfian.

[9]{} G. Baumslag, D. Solitar, [*Some two-generator one-relator
non-Hopfian groups*]{}, Bull. Amer. Math. Soc., 68 (1962) 199–201. (This
paper is .) D. J. Collins, [**]{}, in the [*Online Encyclopaedia of
Mathematics*]{}.
